attributes.action: End discriminatory treatment of pensioners and disabled individuals.
attributes.additional_details: Pensioners and disabled individuals have contributed to society in countless ways and deserve to be treated with respect and dignity. Discriminatory policies that compromise their well-being are not only unjust but also counterproductive. By ensuring fair treatment and adequate support, we strengthen our communities and uphold the values of compassion and equality.
attributes.background: End Discriminatory Policies: Cease any actions or policies that result in the unequal treatment of pensioners and disabled individuals. Implement measures to protect their rights and ensure they receive the support they deserve.

rejection.details:
It is already unlawful to discriminate against someone because of their age or disability (Equality Act 2010), find more information: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/equality-act-2010-guidance

Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
